H0.text: Index fossils are the best method scientists would use to determine the absolute age of a Precambrian igneous rock.

H1.text: The law of superposition is the method that scientists would best use to determine the absolute age of a Precambrian igneous rock.

H2.text: Radiometric dating is the best method for scientists to determine the absolute age of a Precambrian igneous rock.

H3.text: The law of original horizontality is the method scientists would use to determine the absolute age of a Precambrian igneous rock.

A4.text: This scheme is used to date old igneous and metamorphic rocks, and has also been used to date lunar samples

A5.text: Radiometric dating is now the principal source of information about the absolute age of rocks and other geological features, including the age of fossilized life forms or the age of Earth itself
